html: Like the ancient Roman games—which swept up the elite with the masses and led to the fall of an empire—Jehovah’s people are caught up in mass entertainments that appeal to humanity’s baser instincts and even result in deaths. The unruly “commotion and trampling and riot” (v 5) that have become the commonplace of the stadiums and arenas of his people now take a different turn as their enemies invade the land and former spectators flee in a mass stampede. The raucous screams that echoed from city stadiums change to shrieks of terror and people’s light-hearted revelry turns into mortal dread.
